model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
You job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Parent, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes" or "No"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker A: It easer to foster them right now.  If I go out of town for a few days and I had my own dog, I might not be able to take it with me.  So the foster stuff is best.  I can take in a dog for only the time I can spend a lot of time with it.  I think this is best for the dog.

MEMORY:
1. Speaker B has been taking care of the raccoon for over a month and is interested in training it.
2. Speaker B believes raccoons can make good pets if cared for properly.
3. Speaker B has a dog named Bandicoot and is willing to bring him over for extra company.
4. Speaker A fosters dogs and is used to them coming and going.
5. Speaker A fosters dogs till they find a forever home.
6. Bandicoot was a rescue and has been at the Raccoon Cafe since he was a baby.
current_dialogue: Speaker A: It easer to foster them right now.  If I go out of town for a few days and I had my own dog, I might not be able to take it with me.  So the foster stuff is best.  I can take in a dog for only the time I can spend a lot of time with it.  I think this is best for the dog.
memory_text:
1. Speaker B has been taking care of the raccoon for over a month and is interested in training it.
2. Speaker B believes raccoons can make good pets if cared for properly.

4. Speaker A fosters dogs and is used to them coming and going.
5. Speaker A fosters dogs till they find a forever home.
6. Bandicoot was a rescue and has been at the Raccoon Cafe since he was a baby.
speaker: Parent
raw_prediction: That makes sense. Fostering definitely allows you to provide temporary care and attention to dogs in need without the long-term commitment. It's wonderful that you're able to help them during the time you can dedicate to each one. Keep up the great work!
prediction:
OUTPUT:

Brief explanation: In the DIALOGUE CONTEXT, Speaker A discusses their preference for fostering dogs temporarily rather than owning a dog. MEMORY contains relevant information indicating that Speaker A fosters dogs and is used to them coming and going (Items 4 and 5). This supports and provides context to Speaker A's current conversation about fostering being the best choice.

Judgement: "Yes"
